block.p: The blueberries have ripened at Blueberry Park, a Dutchess County farm on Route 21 in Wingdale, N.Y. Its owners, Edward and Anna Tompkins, have 30 acres of wild organic blueberries available for picking from dawn until dusk through mid-August, for $1.25 a pound.

The blueberries have ripened at Blueberry Park, a Dutchess County farm on Route 21 in Wingdale, N.Y. Its owners, Edward and Anna Tompkins, have 30 acres of wild organic blueberries available for picking from dawn until dusk through mid-August, for $1.25 a pound.
For information, including picking conditions and directions: (914) 724-5776.

The ''Help Lick Hunger Festival'' on Aug. 3 from 7 to 11 p.m., which will feature ice creams and ices for tasting, will benefit Rock and Wrap It Up, a group that arranges for leftover food to be picked up from rock concerts and movie shoots and delivered to food banks.
The benefit, at the Gramercy Park Hotel, 2 Lexington Avenue (21st Street), will include entertainment by the rock band Io. Tickets are $36 from (877) 691-3663.

An excursion to pick peaches on Aug. 12, a Saturday, from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m., has been organized by the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. The trip, to Tree-Licious Orchards in Port Murray, N.J., includes lunch. The rain date is Aug. 13. For tickets, $55 for members, $61 for nonmembers: (718) 623-7220.
